DOCNAME: TRANSADO-TRANSPORTES FLUVIAIS DO SADO, S.A. v. PORTUGAL
TEXT: The applicant company , NORP do ORG , is a public limited company formed under NORP law , whose registered office is in GPE ( GPE ) . It was represented before the ORG by PERSON PERSON and PERSON , of ORG .

The applicant company is a river transport company which operated a ferry across the river Sado between ORG and GPE under a concession contract concluded in DATE with the ORG port authorities ( “ the ORG ” ) .

Clause LAW of the contract provided that any dispute concerning the validity , interpretation or execution of the provisions of the concession contract would in all cases be submitted to an arbitration tribunal made up of CARDINAL arbitrators , the first to be appointed by the ORG , the second by the applicant company and DATE the president – by the ORG court .

Clause PERSON of the contract stated that on expiry of the concession the ORG would become the owner of all assets and equipment , including ships . However , GPE would be entitled to compensation in respect of those assets acquired by it with the ORG ’s agreement which had not yet been written off on expiry of the concession ; such compensation would correspond to the value that had not been written off . To this end , the applicant company and the ORG were required to reach agreement on the writing - off periods for the assets in issue .

On DATE the applicant company and the ORG signed a supplementary agreement to the concession contract , fixing the length of the concession at DATE . This period would be automatically extended for DATE unless CARDINAL of the parties repudiated it DATE prior to expiry of the contract . Negotiations were also held between the applicant company and the ORG with a view to amending clause LAW of the concession contract , particularly with regard to the formula for calculating compensation , but these came to nothing . In a letter from the ORG to the applicant company , dated DATE , a concrete proposal on amending clause PERSON was put forward . However , no such amendment to the contract was agreed .
In DATE the applicant company operated a fleet of CARDINAL conventional vessels and ferries which it had bought itself ; CARDINAL had been purchased with the ORG ’s authorisation .

On DATE the ORG informed the applicant company that it did not intend to renew the concession , which would therefore expire on DATE . It referred in particular to the applicant company ’s difficult financial situation and to the problems arising from the considerable sums which it owed to the tax and social security authorities , debts which moreover had entailed the seizure of certain vessels .

On DATE the applicant company submitted its request for compensation to the ORG . It argued that any such compensation ought to be calculated on the basis of the provisions of clause LAW of the concession contract , as amended by the ORG ’s letter of DATE .

On DATE the ORG stated that compensation could be awarded only on the basis of the original wording of clause PERSON of the concession contract , and under no circumstances could any such compensation be awarded on the basis of the amendment proposed on DATE , which had never been agreed .
On DATE the applicant company requested that the arbitration tribunal provided for in clause LAW of the concession contract be convened , with a view to settling the dispute .
The arbitration tribunal was formed on DATE . The applicant company and the ORG both submitted observations and witnesses were questioned .

The arbitration tribunal delivered a unanimous verdict on DATE , dismissing the applicant company ’s request for compensation . Having interpreted clause PERSON , and noting that only the original text of the concession contract could be applied , it stressed that there was nothing in the facts as established to show that the applicant company and the ORG had reached agreement on the writing - off periods for the assets in issue . The compensation request could not therefore succeed .
